feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for New Zealand issued by MetService
feed.rights: Copyright Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited, 2025. Licensed under Creative Commons BY 4.0.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 60 to 90 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Peaks rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but 25 to 40 mm/h possible in localised downpours until this evening. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Included southeast Northland.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect further 80 to 130 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but possibly 25 to 40 mm/h in localised downpours from Tuesday afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Updated event in progress.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 150 to 180 mm of rain, mainly inland. Peak rates of 15 to 25 mm/h, but 25 to 40mm/h possible in localised downpours Tuesday evening until Wednesday morning. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate. Changes: No significant changes.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 80 to 120 mm of rain. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h expected Tuesday evening and Wednesday morning. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: No significant changes.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 140 to 180 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Intensities may reach 20 to 30 mm per hour. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Updated event in progress.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 70 to 90 mm on top of what has already fallen. Rainfall intensities may reach 15 to 20 mm per hour until early afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Updated event in progress. Reduced risk of upgraded.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 60 to 90 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, especially in the ranges. Rainfall intensities of 15 to 20 mm per hour are possible, especially during the afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Low. Changes: Updated event in progress. Reduced risk of upgraded.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 70 to 90 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen, particularly about the Gordon and Richmond Range, and 40 to 60 mm elsewhere. Rainfall intensities of 15 to 20 mm per hour are possible, especially during the afternoon. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Moderate. Changes: Updated event in progress and lowered risk of upgrading.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 90 to 120 mm of rain on top of what has already fallen. Rainfall intensities of 20 to 25 mm per hour are possible. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Updated event in progress.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect 100 to 130 mm of rain about the main divide, and 70 to 100 mm within 15km farther east. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h expected about the divide. Freezing level 2400 m. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Updated event in progress.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Heavy Rain Warning - Orange
entry.summary: Expect a further 60 to 90 mm of rain about the main divide, and 50 to 80 mm within 15km farther east on top of what has already fallen. Peak rates of 10 to 20 mm/h expected about the divide. Freezing level 2400 m. Impact: Streams and rivers may rise rapidly. Surface flooding, slips, and difficult driving conditions possible. Chance of upgrading to a Red Warning: Minimal. Changes: Confined area to northeast of Harris Mountains.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain, and amounts may approach warning criteria. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Low. Changes: Updated event in progress. Reduced risk of upgrade.

entry.title: Heavy Rain Watch
entry.summary: Periods of heavy rain north of Tokomaru Bay, and amounts may approach warning criteria, especially about the ranges. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Reduced risk of upgrade.

entry.title: Strong Wind Watch
entry.summary: Northeast winds may approach severe gale force in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Removed area northwest of Kawakawa and extend time period.

entry.summary: North to northeast winds may approach severe gale force in exposed places. Chance of upgrading to a Warning: Moderate. Changes: Adjusted area to cover south Taranaki coast, extended duration slightly.

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
Rain with heavy falls is expected to affect the Bay of Plenty today and Wednesday morning. Downpours of 25 to 40 mm/h are also expected within the broad area of heavy rain overnight Tuesday and early Wednesday morning, especially east of Kawerau.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited

entry.title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch
entry.summary:
A heavy rain band is expected to move eastwards across the North Island during today. There is mostly a low risk of thunderstorms affecting Northland from about Whangarei southwards, Auckland and Coromandel Peninsula this evening. There is a moderate risk that convection embedded in the rain band will produce localised downpours with rain rates of 25 to 40 mm/h.
Rainfall of this intensity can cause surface and/or flash flooding, especially about low-lying areas such as streams, rivers or narrow valleys, and may also lead to slips. Driving conditions will also be hazardous with surface flooding and poor visibility in heavy rain.

author.name: Meteorological Service of New Zealand Limited
